alert.note: Alert for Clay; Coosa; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 22 at 10:29PM CDT until March 22 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Talladega County in east central Alabama... Northern Coosa County in east central Alabama... Southwestern Clay County in east central Alabama... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 1029 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Marble Valley, or 8 miles west of Weogufka, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Talladega, Sylacauga, Childersburg, Goodwater, Talladega Springs, Weogufka, Stewartville, Hanover, Winterboro, Strickland Crossroads, Marble Valley, Fayetteville, Alpine, Unity, Sycamore, Parkdale, Mitchell Lake, Lay Lake, Cleveland Crossroads and Shelby Shores. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
